intro: Ardisia mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Ardisia mcvaughii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
